section.title: Playing the Game
開始遊玩
section.paragraph: While playing the Pathfinder RPG, the Game Master describes the events that occur in the game world, and the players take turns describing what their characters do in response to those events. Unlike storytelling, however, the actions of the players and the characters controlled by the Game Master (frequently called non-player characters, or NPCs) are not certain. Most actions require dice rolls to determine success, with some tasks being more difficult than others. Each character is better at some things than he is at other things, granting him bonuses based on his skills and abilities.
當進行時，由描述在世界中發生的事件，而們則描述他們扮演的將如何應對這些發生的事件。但與講故事不同的是，們和所控制的（後者經常稱為或）的行動都是不確定的。多數行動需要來決定其成功與否，而有些行為將比其他的行為更加難以完成。每名會在某些方面有所擅長，基於其和來獲得各種。

Whenever a roll is required, the roll is noted as "d#," with the "#" representing the number of sides on the die. If you need to roll multiple dice of the same type, there will be a number before the "d." For example, if you are required to roll 4d6, you should roll four six-sided dice and add the results together. Sometimes there will be a + or – after the notation, meaning that you add that number to, or subtract it from, the total results of the dice (not to each individual die rolled). Most die rolls in the game use a d20 with a number of modifiers based on the character's skills, his or her abilities, and the situation. Generally speaking, rolling high is better than rolling low. Percentile rolls are a special case, indicated as rolling d%. You can generate a random number in this range by rolling two differently colored ten-sided dice (2d10). Pick one color to represent the tens digit, then roll both dice. If the die chosen to be the tens digit rolls a "4" and the other d10 rolls a "2," then you've generated a 42. A zero on the tens digit die indicates a result from 1 to 9, or 100 if both dice result in a zero. Some d10s are printed with "10," "20," "30," and so on in order to make reading d% rolls easier. Unless otherwise noted, whenever you must round a number, always round down.

當需要時，該將被記為「」，其中「#」表示骰子的面數。若你需要投擲同一類型的骰子數次，在「」前還會以數字來表示。舉例而言，若你需要骰，你應該將六面骰投擲四次，並將結果相加。有時在擲骰數後面還會有+或-等加註，意味著你要在的總結果中加上或減去對應數值（注意並非每個骰子的結果）。本遊戲中的大多用到的是，並基於的、和處境等狀況決定。大體而言，結果越高越好。用表示的百分率是一種特殊情況，你可以通過骰兩顆顏色不同的十面骰（）來生成這一範圍的隨機結果。將一顆的結果定為十位數，再同時投擲兩顆骰子。若十位的那顆結果為「4」、另一顆為「2」，那麼你得到的結果為42。十位數的骰子結果為零時代表其結果為1到9，而兩個結果均為零則表示結果為100。某些十面骰會將每面印成「10」、「20」、「30」等以便於進行的和讀數。若無特別說明，當你必須對結果時，總是。

As your character goes on adventures, he earns gold, magic items, and experience points. Gold can be used to purchase better equipment, while magic items possess powerful abilities that enhance your character. Experience points are awarded for overcoming challenges and completing major storylines. When your character has earned enough experience points, he increases his character level by one, granting him new powers and abilities that allow him to take on even greater challenges.
當你的突破一次又一次冒險時，他會獲得金錢、和等等。金錢可以用來獲取更好的，能夠給予各種強化的能力，是贏下挑戰和完成任務的獎勵。當你的積攢了足夠多的時，他的會上升一級並獲取使自己足以面對更大挑戰的新力量與能力。

section.title: The Most Important Rule
最重要的規則
section.paragraph: The rules presented are here to help you breathe life into your characters and the world they explore. While they are designed to make your game easy and exciting, you might find that some of them do not suit the style of play that your gaming group enjoys. Remember that these rules are yours. You can change them to fit your needs. Most Game Masters have a number of "house rules" that they use in their games. The Game Master and players should always discuss any rules changes to make sure that everyone understands how the game will be played. Although the Game Master is the final arbiter of the rules, the Pathfinder RPG is a shared experience, and all of the players should contribute their thoughts when the rules are in doubt.

此處的規則是協助你融入自己的並探索世界。雖然它們是為了讓你的簡單刺激而被設計的，你也許會發現其中一些規則並不適於你所在圈子的遊戲風格。請記住，規則是屬於你的，你可以根據需要來改變或調整它們。多數會在自己的中設定一系列「」，和應該在對規則進行任何調整前展開討論，以確保每個人都了解當前的正以怎樣的形式展開。儘管是規則的最終裁決者，遊戲體驗畢竟是大家共同分享的，因此每位都應該在對規則存疑時提出自己的看法。

section.title: Common Terms
通用術語
section.paragraph: The Pathfinder RPG uses a number of terms, abbreviations, and definitions in presenting the rules of the game. The following are among the most common.
在的規則中使用了許多術語、縮寫以及定義，以下為最常使用的術語。

com:term.com:name: Ability Score
com:term.com:description: Each creature has six ability scores: Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma. These scores represent a creature's most basic attributes. The higher the score, the more raw potential and talent your character possesses.
每名都具有六項︰、、、、和。這些數值體現了一名最基本的特徵。數值越高，你的的潛力和天賦就越出色。

com:term.com:name: Action
動作
com:term.com:description: An action is a discrete measurement of time during a round of combat. Using abilities, casting spells, and making attacks all require actions to perform. There are a number of different kinds of actions, such as a standard action, move action, swift action, free action, and full-round action (see Combat).
是一中衡量行為耗時程度的概念，使用能力、施展和發動都需要消耗一定的。的種類很多，像是、、、和等（）。

com:term.com:name: Alignment
com:term.com:description: Alignment represents a creature's basic moral and ethical attitude. Alignment has two components: one describing whether a creature is lawful, neutral, or chaotic, followed by another that describes whether a character is good, neutral, or evil. Alignments are usually abbreviated using the first letter of each alignment component, such as LN for lawful neutral or CE for chaotic evil. Creatures that are neutral in both components are denoted by a single "N."
呈現了一名基本的道德和倫理觀念。有兩條主軸，一條描述是、還是的，另一條描述是、還是的。常以每條主軸的首字母縮寫表示，譬如表示、表示等，在兩條主軸上都傾向的僅以單字「」表示。

com:term.com:name: Armor Class (AC)
com:term.com:description: All creatures in the game have an Armor Class. This score represents how hard it is to hit a creature in combat. As with other scores, higher is better.
所有中的都有。這一數值呈現了在中擊中一名的困難程度。與其他數值一樣，愈高愈好。

com:term.com:name: Base Attack Bonus (BAB)
com:term.com:description: Each creature has a base attack bonus and it represents its skill in combat. As a character gains levels or Hit Dice, his base attack bonus improves. When a creature's base attack bonus reaches +6, +11, or +16, he receives an additional attack in combat when he takes a full-attack action (which is one type of full-round action—see Combat).
每名都有用來展現其技巧的。當獲得新的或時，其將會提高。當一名的達到+6、+11或+16時，他會在進行時獲得一次額外的次數（屬於，詳情請）。

com:term.com:name: Bonus
com:term.com:description: Bonuses are numerical values that are added to checks and statistical scores. Most bonuses have a type, and as a general rule, bonuses of the same type are not cumulative (do not "stack")—only the greater bonus granted applies.
為增加到結果和統計數據上的數值。多數都有其類型，作為基本規則之一，同一類型的不會重復計算（即不「」）——僅有數值最高的將被計算。

com:term.com:name: Caster Level (CL)
com:term.com:description: Caster level represents a creature's power and ability when casting spells. When a creature casts a spell, it often contains a number of variables, such as range or damage, that are based on the caster's level.
呈現了一名施展時的能力與強度。當施展時，其中往往含有一系列變量，譬如或等，這些變量常由決定。

com:term.com:name: Class
com:term.com:description: Classes represent chosen professions taken by characters and some other creatures. Classes give a host of bonuses and allow characters to take actions that they otherwise could not, such as casting spells or changing shape. As a creature gains levels in a given class, it gains new, more powerful abilities. Most PCs gain levels in the core classes or prestige classes, since these are the most powerful. Most NPCs gain levels in NPC classes, which are less powerful (see Creating NPCs).
呈現了和其他一些所選擇的專業方向。為提供了一系列並允許做出一些他人無法完成的行動，譬如施展或改變身形等。當在某上獲得新時，他將得到新的、更強大的能力。多數獲得或的，因為這些強度最高。多數獲得的，它們強度較低（創造）。

com:term.com:name: Check
com:term.com:description: A check is a d20 roll which may or may not be modified by another value. The most common types are attack rolls, ability checks, skill checks, and saving throws.
一次是指包含或不包含其他的。最常見的情形為、、和。

com:term.com:name: Combat Maneuver
com:term.com:description: This is an action taken in combat that does not directly cause harm to your opponent, such as attempting to trip him, disarm him, or grapple with him (see Combat).
這是一種在中並不直接給對手造成的，譬如嘗試將他、或等等（）。

com:term.com:name: Combat Maneuver Bonus (CMB)
com:term.com:description: This value represents how skilled a creature is at performing a combat maneuver. When attempting to perform a combat maneuver, this value is added to the character's d20 roll.
該數值呈現了在發動時的熟練程度。每當嘗試發動時，將此數值加至的上。

com:term.com:name: Combat Maneuver Defense (CMD)
com:term.com:description: This score represents how hard it is to perform a combat maneuver against this creature. A creature's CMD is used as the difficulty class when performing a maneuver against that creature.
該數值呈現了對這名發動時的困難程度，被施展的將作為來使用。

com:term.com:name: Concentration Check
com:term.com:description: When a creature is casting a spell, but is disrupted during the casting, he must make a concentration check or fail to cast the spell (see Magic).
當在施展時遭到干擾，他必須通過，否則將無法施展（）。

com:term.com:name: Creature
com:term.com:description: A creature is an active participant in the story or world. This includes PCs, NPCs, and monsters.
是指在故事或世界中的活動對象，包括、和。

com:term.com:name: Damage Reduction (DR)
com:term.com:description: Creatures that are resistant to harm typically have damage reduction. This amount is subtracted from any damage dealt to them from a physical source. Most types of DR can be bypassed by certain types of weapons. This is denoted by a "/" followed by the type, such as "10/cold iron." Some types of DR apply to all physical attacks. Such DR is denoted by the "—" symbol. See Special Abilities for more information.
對具備抵抗能力的通常擁有。物理來源的任何將減去此數值後再作用於該。大多數可以被特定類型的所無視，該類型將標注在「/」符號之後，譬如「」。有些類型的對所有物理攻擊均有效，這些將以「-」符號來表示。詳情特殊能力。

com:term.com:name: Difficulty Class (DC)
com:term.com:description: Whenever a creature attempts to perform an action whose success is not guaranteed, he must make some sort of check (usually a skill check). The result of that check must meet or exceed the Difficulty Class of the action that the creature is attempting to perform in order for the action to be successful.
每當將要進行一項並非必然成功的時，他必須進行某種（通常是）。該的結果必須達到或超過這次的才能視為成功。

com:term.com:name: Extraordinary Abilities (Ex)
com:term.com:description: Extraordinary abilities are unusual abilities that do not rely on magic to function.
是不依賴於便能生效的、不尋常的能力。

com:term.com:name: Experience Points (XP)
com:term.com:description: As a character overcomes challenges, defeats monsters, and completes quests, he gains experience points. These points accumulate over time, and when they reach or surpass a specific value, the character gains a level.
當通過挑戰、擊敗或完成任務時，他將會獲得。這些隨時間累積，在達到特定數值時使提升一個。

com:term.com:name: Feat
com:term.com:description: A feat is an ability a creature has mastered. Feats often allow creatures to circumvent rules or restrictions. Creatures receive a number of feats based off their Hit Dice, but some classes and other abilities grant bonus feats.
是已經掌握的一種能力。通常會允許突破規則或限制。擁有的數量基於該的，但某些或也會帶來。

com:term.com:name: Game Master (GM)
com:term.com:description: A Game Master is the person who adjudicates the rules and controls all of the elements of the story and world that the players explore. A GM's duty is to provide a fair and fun game.
是在探索的故事和世界中裁定規則、控制一切要素的人選。的職責是提供公平而有趣的。

com:term.com:name: Hit Dice (HD)
com:term.com:description: Hit Dice represent a creature's general level of power and skill. As a creature gains levels, it gains additional Hit Dice. Monsters, on the other hand, gain racial Hit Dice, which represent the monster's general prowess and ability. Hit Dice are represented by the number the creature possesses followed by a type of die, such as "3d8." This value is used to determine a creature's total hit points. In this example, the creature has 3 Hit Dice. When rolling for this creature's hit points, you would roll a d8 three times and add the results together, along with other modifiers.
呈現了一名力量與技能的大致水平。當升級時，它將獲得額外的。而獲得的則為呈現其整體強度與能力的。以擁有的特定類型骰數來表示，譬如「」。這一數值也用來衡量的總，在此例中，該生物擁有三個。當決定該的時，你將骰三次並將結果相加，再加上其他。

com:term.com:name: Hit Points (HP)
com:term.com:description: Hit points are an abstraction signifying how robust and healthy a creature is at the current moment. To determine a creature's hit points, roll the dice indicated by its Hit Dice. A creature gains maximum hit points if its first Hit Die roll is for a character class level. Creatures whose first Hit Die comes from an NPC class or from his race roll their first Hit Die normally. Wounds subtract hit points, while healing (both natural and magical) restores hit points. Some abilities and spells grant temporary hit points that disappear after a specific duration. When a creature's hit points drop below 0, it becomes unconscious. When a creature's hit points reach a negative total equal to its Constitution score, it dies.
是呈現當前強壯與健康程度的抽象數值。決定的時，按其進行。如果的第一個為，將其取最大值，若的第一個為或其則如常。將使降低，而治療（包括自然的和魔法的）能夠回復。某些和能夠帶來，這些將在持續一定時間後消失。當的被降至零以下時，它將。當的被降至等同於其的負值時，它將。

com:term.com:name: Initiative
com:term.com:description: Whenever combat begins, all creatures involved in the battle must make an initiative check to determine the order in which creatures act during combat. The higher the result of the check, the earlier a creature gets to act.
當開始時，所有參與的必須進行，以決定在中的行動順序。結果越高，越早開始行動。

com:term.com:name: Level
com:term.com:description: A character's level represents his overall ability and power. There are three types of levels. Class level is the number of levels of a specific class possessed by a character. Character level is the sum of all of the levels possessed by a character in all of his classes. In addition, spells have a level associated with them numbered from 0 to 9. This level indicates the general power of the spell. As a spellcaster gains levels, he learns to cast spells of a higher level.
的呈現了他整體的能力水準。有三種類型的，是指在特定上獲得的，是指所有已獲得的的總和。此外，也有著從0到9的，此呈現了的大致強度，當升級時，他將學會施展更高的。

com:term.com:name: Monster
com:term.com:description: Monsters are creatures that rely on racial Hit Dice instead of class levels for their powers and abilities (although some possess class levels as well). PCs are usually not monsters.
是依靠而非來衡量其強度與能力的（儘管某些同樣有）。通常都不是。

com:term.com:name: Multiplying
com:term.com:description: When you are asked to apply more than one multiplier to a roll, the multipliers are not multiplied by one another. Instead, you combine them into a single multiplier, with each extra multiple adding 1 less than its value to the first multiple. For example, if you are asked to apply a ×2 multiplier twice, the result would be ×3, not ×4.
當你的某次出現超過一種的時，之間並非疊乘，而是疊加為單一，每個額外的將會減1後加至總。舉例而言，若你需要添加兩次，合併後的將為，而非。

com:term.com:name: Nonplayer Character (NPC)
com:term.com:description: These are characters controlled by the GM.
這些由控制。

com:term.com:name: Penalty
com:term.com:description: Penalties are numerical values that are subtracted from a check or statistical score. Penalties do not have a type and most penalties stack with one another.
是從結果和統計數據中減去的數值。並無類型之分，因此多數都會彼此。

com:term.com:name: Player Character (Character, PC)
com:term.com:description: These are the characters portrayed by the players.
這些由控制。

com:term.com:name: Round
com:term.com:description: Combat is measured in rounds. During an individual round, all creatures have a chance to take a turn to act, in order of initiative. A round represents 6 seconds in the game world.
以來計時。在獨立的一中，所有按其順序均有一行動機會。世界中的一包含6秒。

com:term.com:name: Rounding
com:term.com:description: Occasionally the rules ask you to round a result or value. Unless otherwise stated, always round down. For example, if you are asked to take half of 7, the result would be 3.
規則有時會要求你對結果或數值，若無特別說明，總是。譬如，若你需要對7減半，那麼結果為3。

com:term.com:name: Saving Throw
com:term.com:description: When a creature is the subject of a dangerous spell or effect, it often receives a saving throw to mitigate the damage or result. Saving throws are passive, meaning that a character does not need to take an action to make a saving throw—they are made automatically. There are three types of saving throws: Fortitude (used to resist poisons, diseases, and other bodily ailments), Reflex (used to avoid effects that target an entire area, such as fireball), and Will (used to resist mental attacks and spells).
當成為某一危險或效果的對象時，他往往會擁有一次減輕其或效果的機會。是被動的，意味著無需消耗即可進行——它們都是自動展開的。包括三種類型︰（用來抵抗、和其他肉體危害）、（用來避免影響整片區域的效果，如等）和（用來抵抗和）。

com:term.com:name: Skill
com:term.com:description: A skill represents a creature's ability to perform an ordinary task, such as climb a wall, sneak down a hallway, or spot an intruder. The number of ranks possessed by a creature in a given skill represents its proficiency in that skill. As a creature gains Hit Dice, it also gains additional skill ranks that can be added to its skills.
呈現了完成特定工作的能力，譬如爬過牆壁、在走廊中潛行、或偵察到侵襲者等等。在特定上的受訓級數展現了其針對該的熟練程度。每當獲得，它將獲得新的，並可用來提高其受訓級數。

com:term.com:name: Spell
com:term.com:description: Spells can perform a wide variety of tasks, from harming enemies to bringing the dead back to life. Spells specify what they can target, what their effects are, and how they can be resisted or negated.
可以實現的內容範圍極廣，從傷害敵人到起死回生。按其、、抵抗方式或無效化等類型來加以區分。

com:term.com:name: Spell-Like Abilities (Sp)
com:term.com:description: Spell-like abilities function just like spells, but are granted through a special racial ability or by a specific class ability (as opposed to spells, which are gained by spellcasting classes as a character gains levels).
的功能如同，但其通過特定的能力或能力來加以獲得（而則是通過在可施法的上提升來獲得）。

com:term.com:name: Spell Resistance (SR)
com:term.com:description: Some creatures are resistant to magic and gain spell resistance. When a creature with spell resistance is targeted by a spell, the caster of the spell must make a caster level check to see if the spell affects the target. The DC of this check is equal to the target creature's SR (some spells do not allow SR checks).
某些擁有，能夠抵抗效果。當擁有的成為某一的時，該的必須進行來決定該是否能夠影響到。的等同於的（某些可以無視，因此無需）。

com:term.com:name: Stacking
com:term.com:description: Stacking refers to the act of adding together bonuses or penalties that apply to one particular check or statistic. Generally speaking, most bonuses of the same type do not stack. Instead, only the highest bonus applies. Most penalties do stack, meaning that their values are added together. Penalties and bonuses generally stack with one another, meaning that the penalties might negate or exceed part or all of the bonuses, and vice versa.
是指對一次特定的或一項統計數據，將所有或合併計算的行為。大體而言，大多數類型相同的不會，而是只有最高者生效。多數相互，意味著它們的數值將被合併計算。和通常相互，意味著可能會抵消或超過，反之亦然。

com:term.com:name: Supernatural Abilities (Su)
com:term.com:description: Supernatural abilities are magical attacks, defenses, and qualities. These abilities can be always active or they can require a specific action to utilize. The supernatural ability's description includes information on how it is used and its effects.
是神奇的、防禦和計量效果。這些能力可能持續生效，也可能通過特定來啟動。的敘述包括了其如何使用及為何等訊息。

com:term.com:name: Turn
com:term.com:description: In a round, a creature receives one turn, during which it can perform a wide variety of actions. Generally in the course of one turn, a character can perform one standard action, one move action, one swift action, and a number of free actions. Less-common combinations of actions are permissible as well, see Combat for more details.
在一裡，每個可以擁有一個，可以在其中展開一系列的。大致而言，在其中可以進行一個、一個、一個以及一些。較為罕見的組合同樣存在，詳情請。

section.title: Generating a Character
創造
section.paragraph: From the sly rogue to the stalwart paladin, the Pathfinder RPG allows you to make the character you want to play. When generating a character, start with your character's concept. Do you want a character who goes toe-to-toe with terrible monsters, matching sword and shield against claws and fangs? Or do you want a mystical seer who draws his powers from the great beyond to further his own ends? Nearly anything is possible.
從詭計多端的到堅韌不屈的，允許你創造出想要扮演的各種。在創造時，首先應設定好的大致輪廓。你是想要一位以與和恐怖的以血搏血的，還是想要一位從超越自身與世界彼端之處獲取力量的神秘先知？一切皆有可能。

Once you have a general concept worked out, use the following steps to bring your idea to life, recording the resulting information and statistics on your Pathfinder RPG character sheet, which can be found at the back of this book and photocopied for your convenience.
當你確定了的大致輪廓后，請通過以下步驟使鮮活起來，並將必要的訊息和統計數據記錄在上，其附在本書後面以方便你影印。

cre:step.cre:title: Determine Ability Scores
決定
cre:step.cre:description: Start by generating your character's ability scores. These six scores determine your character's most basic attributes and are used to decide a wide variety of details and statistics. Some class selections require you to have better than average scores for some of your abilities.
一切從生成的開始。這六項數值決定了大部分的基本能力，並將被用來確定一系列的細節和統計數據。某些會要求你的某項高於平均水準。

cre:step.cre:title: Pick Your Race
選定
cre:step.cre:description: Next, pick your character's race, noting any modifiers to your ability scores and any other racial traits (see Races). There are seven basic races to choose from, although your GM might have others to add to the list. Each race lists the languages your character automatically knows, as well as a number of bonus languages. A character knows a number of additional bonus languages equal to his or her Intelligence modifier.
其次請為你的選定，為加註所有的，並記錄下其他獲得的（）。你能夠從七大中挑選，而你的也許會增添可選用的列表。每個都列出了你的將自動掌握的，以及可能的。所掌握的額外數量等同於他的。

cre:step.cre:title: Pick Your Class
選定
cre:step.cre:description: A character's class represents a profession, such as fighter or wizard. If this is a new character, he starts at 1st level in his chosen class. As he gains experience points (XP) for defeating monsters, he goes up in level, granting him new powers and abilities.
的呈現其專業方向，譬如或。若這是一位新，他將以選定的從1級開始冒險。當他通過打倒獲得了足夠多的〔〕並升級時，他將獲得新的特性和能力。

cre:step.cre:title: Pick Skills and Select Feats
選定與
cre:step.cre:description: Determine the number of skill ranks possessed by your character, based on his class and Intelligence modifier (and any other bonuses, such as the bonus received by humans). Then spend these ranks on skills, but remember that you cannot have more ranks than your level in any one skill (for a starting character, this is usually one). After skills, determine how many feats your character receives, based on his class and level, and select them from those presented in Feats.
基於的和（以及其他，譬如的），決定你的角色所擁有的技能點數。再將技能點數用來購買每種技能的受訓級數，不過要注意你不能使某一項技能的受訓級數超過角色等級（對初始角色而言通常為一級）。在選定技能之後，基於角色的職業和等級來確認角色掌握的專長數量，並從可選列表中挑選專長。

cre:step.cre:title: Buy Equipment
選購
cre:step.cre:description: Each new character begins the game with an amount of gold, based on his class, that can be spent on a wide range of equipment and gear, from chainmail armor to leather backpacks. This gear helps your character survive while adventuring. Generally speaking, you cannot use this starting money to buy magic items without the consent of your GM.
每位新在起始時基於其擁有一定數量的金錢，可以用來選購許多與工具，從到等。這些工具協助你的在冒險中生存下來。一般而言，若無你的同意，你無法用起始金錢購買。

cre:step.cre:title: Finishing Details
完成細節
cre:step.cre:description: Finally, you need to determine all of a character's details, including his starting hit points (hp), Armor Class (AC), saving throws, initiative modifier, and attack values. All of these numbers are determined by the decisions made in previous steps. Aside from these, you need to decide on your character's name, alignment, and physical appearance. It is best to jot down a few personality traits as well, to help you play the character during the game. Additional rules (like age and alignment) are described in Additional Rules.
最後，你需要決定一名的所有細節，包括起始（）、（）、、以及數值等。所有這些數值都由前幾個步驟中你所做出的選擇來決定。除此以外，你還需要決定的姓名、、體貌特徵等。最好還能設定一些人格特徵，以協助你在中扮演該。額外的規則（譬如與）請額外規則。

section.title: Ability Scores
section.paragraph: Each character has six ability scores that represent his character's most basic attributes. They are his raw talent and prowess. While a character rarely rolls an ability check (using just an ability score), these scores, and the modifiers they create, affect nearly every aspect of a character's skills and abilities. Each ability score generally ranges from 3 to 18, although racial bonuses and penalties can alter this; an average ability score is 10.

section.title: Generating Ability Scores
生成
section.paragraph: There are a number of different methods used to generate ability scores. Each of these methods gives a different level of flexibility and randomness to character generation.
Racial modifiers (adjustments made to your ability scores due to your character's race—see Races) are applied after the scores are generated.

ga:method.ga:name: Standard
標準
ga:method.ga:description: Roll 4d6, discard the lowest die result, and add the three remaining results together. Record this total and repeat the process until six numbers are generated. Assign these totals to your ability scores as you see fit. This method is less random than Classic and tends to create characters with above-average ability scores.

ga:method.ga:name: Classic
經典
ga:method.ga:description: Roll 3d6 and add the dice together. Record this total and repeat the process until you generate six numbers. Assign these results to your ability scores as you see fit. This method is quite random, and some characters will have clearly superior abilities. This randomness can be taken one step further, with the totals applied to specific ability scores in the order they are rolled. Characters generated using this method are difficult to fit to predetermined concepts, as their scores might not support given classes or personalities, and instead are best designed around their ability scores.

ga:method.ga:name: Heroic
英雄
ga:method.ga:description: Roll 2d6 and add 6 to the sum of the dice. Record this total and repeat the process until six numbers are generated. Assign these totals to your ability scores as you see fit. This is less random than the Standard method and generates characters with mostly above-average scores.

ga:method.ga:name: Dice Pool
骰池
ga:method.ga:description: Each character has a pool of 24d6 to assign to his statistics. Before the dice are rolled, the player selects the number of dice to roll for each score, with a minimum of 3d6 for each ability. Once the dice have been assigned, the player rolls each group and totals the result of the three highest dice. For more high-powered games, the GM should increase the total number of dice to 28. This method generates characters of a similar power to the Standard method.

ga:method.ga:name: Purchase
購點
ga:method.ga:description: Each character receives a number of points to spend on increasing his basic attributes. In this method, all attributes start at a base of 10. A character can increase an individual score by spending some of his points. Likewise, he can gain more points to spend on other scores by decreasing one or more of his ability scores. No score can be reduced below 7 or raised above 18 using this method. See Table: Ability Score Costs for the costs of each score. After all the points are spent, apply any racial modifiers the character might have.

The number of points you have to spend using the purchase method depends on the type of campaign you are playing. The standard value for a character is 15 points. Average nonplayer characters (NPCs) are typically built using as few as 3 points. See Table: Ability Score Points for a number of possible point values depending on the style of campaign. The purchase method emphasizes player choice and creates equally balanced characters. This system is typically used for organized play events, such as the Pathfinder Society (visit paizo.com/pathfinderSociety for more details on this exciting campaign).

section.title: Determine Bonuses
section.paragraph: Each ability, after changes made because of race, has a modifier ranging from –5 to +5. Table: Ability Modifiers and Bonus Spells shows the modifier for each score. The modifier is the number you apply to the die roll when your character tries to do something related to that ability. You also use the modifier with some numbers that aren't die rolls. A positive modifier is called a bonus, and a negative modifier is called a penalty. The table also shows bonus spells, which you'll need to know about if your character is a spellcaster.

contains.contain: 每個character都有六種ability_score，代表了他的character最基本的『屬性』。它們是他最原始的天賦和實力。雖然character很少僅用『屬性』來進行ability check，但這些ability score及它們的modifier幾乎影響到了character的全部skill和能力。每項ability score的範圍通常是3到18，雖然race的bonus或penalty會改變這個範圍；ability score的平均值是10。
有很多種不同的方法可以用來生成ability score。這些方法按照生成character的靈活性和隨機性分成了幾種類型。『種族調整』（依照你character的race對ability check進行的調整；詳見race部分）在abilityscore生成完畢后才生效。

ga:descriptions.ga:description: 投3d6，丟棄最低的一個結果，並將其餘三個結果相加。記錄這個數值並重復該過程，直到六個數值都生成完畢。將這些數值按照你認為合適的方式分配至你的ability score上。這種方法的隨機性比經典方法小，並且傾向於創造高於平均水準的character。

投3d6並將結果相加。記錄這個數值並重復該過程，直到六個數值都生成完畢。將這些數值按照你認為合適的方式分配至你的ability score上。這種方法相當的隨機，有些character可能會擁有明顯較優的『屬性』。這種隨機性可以更進一步︰將投出的數值按投出的順序分配至ability score上，而不是隨意分配。用這種方法生成的character很難與預先設計好的概念符合，因為character的ability score可能不支持給定的class或個性。因此最合理的方式還是圍繞character的ability score來設計character。
投2d6+6，記錄這個數值並重復該過程，直到六個數值都生成完畢。將這些數值按照你認為合適的方式分配至你的ability score上。這種方法的隨機性比標准方法小，並且創建character的大多數ability score都高於平均水準。
每名character都有一個24d6的骰池供其分配。在投骰之前，player需要選擇分配某一『屬性』的骰子數量，最小為3d6。骰子分配完之後，player為每組骰子投點並取其最高的三個數值。對於『高難度』的遊戲，GM應該將骰子的總數增加至28。這種方法生成的character與標準方法類似。

每名character獲得一些用於增加其基本『屬性』的點數。在購點法中，所有的『屬性』的基礎值為10。character可以花費一定購點來使一項『屬性』增加1點；同樣，他也可以通過降低他的一項或多項『屬性』來獲取更多的購點。ability score無法降低到7以下或提升至18以上。詳見下表來查看每檔ability score的購點花費。在所有購點都使用完畢后，再將『種族調整』（如果character有的話）應用到ability score上。你在購點法中所擁有的點數取決於你在玩的戰役的難度類型。普通戰役的character購點是15點，而普通NPC的購點通常只有為數不多的3點。詳見下表來查找基於不同戰役類型的購點數量變化。

contains.contain: 每項『屬性』在經過生成和『種族調整』後，會具有範圍為-5到+5的modifier。modifier為你在做某件基於該『屬性』的事情時加至『檢定結果』的數值。你也會在check以外的一些情況下使用到modifier。正的modifier又被稱為bonus，負的modifier則被稱為penalty。下表列出了ability score與其modifier之間的關系。若你是一名caster，下表還列出了基於ability score而獲得的『獎勵法術』。
哪一項『屬性』將用來確認你的『獎勵法術』取決於你屬于哪一類caster。對wizard而言為Int，對cleric、druid和ranger而言為Wis，對bard、paladin和sorcerer而言為Cha。除了達到『屬性』要求，caster還需要擁有足夠高的class level才能夠施展對應spell level的法術。具體請查看各class的詳述部分。
每項『屬性』都部分闡釋了你的character，並會影響他的行動。

abi:descriptions.abi:description: Str量化了character的肌肉和體能水準。這項『屬性』對參與近身搏鬥（即『近戰』）的character尤為重要，譬如fighter、monk、paladin和部分ranger。Str同時決定了你的character的『負重上限』。一名Str『屬性』為0的character過於孱弱、以至於無法以任何方式『移動』，並因此陷入『昏迷』。有些creature不具有Str『屬性』，並在基於Str的skill和check中完全沒有modifier。

abi:uses.abi:use: 使用『近戰武器』或『投擲武器』（包括『投石索』）時的『傷害檢定』。（特例︰『副手攻擊』只有character一半的『力量加值』，『雙手武器』attack則擁有1.5倍的『力量加值』；而『力量減值』將作用在非『復合弓』做出的attack上。）

abi:descriptions.abi:description: Dex量化了靈活度、反射力以及平衡性。這項『屬性』是rogue最關鍵的『屬性』，但對那些通常穿戴『輕甲』或『中甲』、甚至不穿『甲』的character都很重要。這項『屬性』對任何想成為優秀射手的character而言也舉足輕重。一名『敏捷屬性』為0的character完全無法『移動』，相當于『癱瘓』（但並未『昏迷』）。

abi:uses.abi:use: 『遠程攻擊檢定』，包括『弓』、『弩』、『飛斧』以及『灼熱射線』、『陽炎射線』等『遠程法術攻擊』。
『反射豁免檢定』，你能夠依靠快速『移動』來躲開『火球術』和其他一些attack。
『特技』、『解除裝置』、『脫逃』、『飛行』、『騎術』、『巧手』和『隱匿』『技能檢定』。

abi:descriptions.abi:description: Con量化了character的健康和耐力。『體質加值』能增加character的HP，所以它對所有class都很重要。某些creature沒有『體質屬性』，譬如『不死生物』和『構裝體』；它們基於『體質屬性』的『檢定修正值』視為+0。一名『體質屬性』為0的character將『死亡』。

abi:uses.abi:use: 每個HD的roll（但『體質減值』永遠不能使結果低於1——也就是說，character每次『升級』時至少能獲得1點HP）。
『強韌豁免檢定』，用於抵抗『毒素』、『疾病』及類似的威脅。

abi:ability.abi:mark: 如果character『體質值』的改變足以使其『體質修正值』發生變化，character的HP也會相應地增加或減少。

abi:descriptions.abi:description: Wis量化了character學習和推理的能力。這項『屬性』對wizard非常重要，因為它從各個方面影響了他們的『施法能力』。僅有動物本能級別智能的creature，其『智力值』為1或2。任何足以理解語言的creature至少擁有3點『智力值』。一名『智力屬性』為0的character是『昏厥』的。某些creature沒有『智力屬性』；它們基於『智力屬性』的『技能或檢定修正值』視為+0。

abi:uses.abi:use: 遊戲起始時所掌握的『獎勵語言』數目。這是任何起始『種族語言』和『通用語』額外的部分。若你的Wis為penalty，你依然能夠通過你的『種族語言』來閱讀和交談，除非你的『智力值』低於3。
每level獲得的『技能點數』，不過你的character每級至少能獲得1點『技能點』。
估價、工藝、知識、語言學和法術辨識技能檢定。

abi:ability.abi:mark: wizard基於『智力值』得到『每日獎勵法術』。施放一個『法師法術』所需要的最低『智力值』為「10+spell level」。

abi:descriptions.abi:description: Wis量化了character的意志力、常識判斷力、警覺性和直覺。Wis是cleric和druid最重要的『屬性』，對paladin和ranger也很重要。如果你希望你的character擁有敏銳的直覺，那就給他較高的『感知值』。任何creature都有『感知屬性』。一名『感知屬性』為0的character完全無法理性思考，並因此陷入『昏迷』。

abi:uses.abi:use: 『意志豁免檢定』（用於對抗『魅惑人類』之類的spell）。
『醫療』、『察覺』、『專業』、『察言觀色』和『生存』『技能檢定』。

abi:ability.abi:mark: cleric、druid和ranger基於『感知值』得到『每日獎勵法術』。『施放』一個『牧師、德魯依或游俠法術』所需要的最低『感知值』為「10+spell level」。

abi:descriptions.abi:description: Cha量化了character的人格魄力、個人吸引力、領導力和外觀容姿。這項屬性對paladin、sorcerer和bard最為重要。它對cleric也很重要，因為它影響着cleric『引導能量』的能力。對『不死生物』而言，Cha量化了它們『非自然的生命力』的強度。任何creature都有『魅力屬性』。一名『魅力屬性』為0的character無法以任何方式控制自我，並因此陷入『昏迷』。

abi:uses.abi:use: 『唬騙』、『交涉』、『易容』、『馴養動物』、『威嚇』、『表演』和『使用魔法裝置』『技能檢定』。
cleric和paladin的『引導能量DC』，用來傷害『不死生物』。

abi:ability.abi:mark: bard、paladin和sorcerer基於『魅力值』得到『每日獎勵法術』。施放一個『吟遊詩人、聖騎士或術士法術』所需要的最低『魅力值』為「10+spell level」。
